docs.abstract: Mr. Yang championed putting money in the pockets of every American adult during his presidential campaign. Now, amid the coronavirus crisis, “This thing is going to pass,” he says.
docs.snippet: Mr. Yang championed putting money in the pockets of every American adult during his presidential campaign. Now, amid the coronavirus crisis, “This thing is going to pass,” he says.
docs.lead_paragraph: For more than two years, Andrew Yang traveled the country as a presidential candidate trying to convince voters that a crisis was coming. The economy was going to evolve, he warned, jobs would be automated away in droves and many Americans were going to find themselves at home without a paycheck.

headline.main: Andrew Yang’s $1,000-a-Month Idea May Have Seemed Absurd Before. Not Now.
headline.print_headline: Two Months Ago, $1,000 a Month Per Person Seemed Crazy. Not Now.

byline.original: By Matt Stevens and Isabella Grullón Paz

docs.abstract: Discussions to push back the state’s primary because of the coronavirus crisis came as several states that vote on Tuesday were cautiously moving ahead, and as Bernie Sanders voiced concerns.
docs.snippet: Discussions to push back the state’s primary because of the coronavirus crisis came as several states that vote on Tuesday were cautiously moving ahead, and as Bernie Sanders voiced concerns.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York officials are considering plans to postpone the state’s presidential primary election in April as fears over the coronavirus outbreak grow and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention cautioned against gatherings of more than 50 people.

headline.main: New York Officials Weigh Delaying April Primary Election
headline.print_headline: New York Considers Delay Of April’s Primary Voting

byline.original: By Stephanie Saul and Nick Corasaniti

docs.abstract: New figures show just how big a financial hole the former vice president was in before he pulled off a remarkable turnaround in the Democratic race.
docs.snippet: New figures show just how big a financial hole the former vice president was in before he pulled off a remarkable turnaround in the Democratic race.
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has taken command of the Democratic primary for president despite running on a shoestring budget in a contest where Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont raised more money in February alone, $47.6 million, than Mr. Biden had spent in his previous five months combined, new federal records show.

headline.main: Joe Biden’s Campaign Was Cash Poor. He Seized Control of the Nomination Anyway.
headline.print_headline: His Rivals Widely Outspent Biden, Even as He Seized Control of Race

byline.original: By Shane Goldmacher and Rachel Shorey

docs.abstract: For the first time, millennials and Generation Z have enough electoral clout to seriously compete with their elders. But many feel more disillusioned than empowered.
docs.snippet: For the first time, millennials and Generation Z have enough electoral clout to seriously compete with their elders. But many feel more disillusioned than empowered.
docs.lead_paragraph: The oldest of them were just out of college on 9/11; the youngest were not yet born. Over the two decades that followed, they all came of age under storm clouds: of war, of recession, of mass shootings, wildfires and now a pandemic.

headline.main: Young Voters Know What They Want. But They Don’t See Anyone Offering It.
headline.print_headline: Who Will Speak to America’s Young People?

docs.abstract: On a night largely overshadowed by the global pandemic, Bernie Sanders pressed Joe Biden on his past Senate voting record as Mr. Biden sought to woo the left.
docs.snippet: On a night largely overshadowed by the global pandemic, Bernie Sanders pressed Joe Biden on his past Senate voting record as Mr. Biden sought to woo the left.
docs.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus, “Medicare for all,” old Senate votes, the Iraq War, Social Security, gun control, immigration, visions of leadership: They were all on the table Sunday night in the first one-on-one debate between Senator Bernie Sanders and former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., a matchup that comes two days before four delegate-rich states hold primaries.

headline.main: Six Takeaways From the March Democratic Debate
headline.print_headline: Six Takeaways From a One-on-One Democratic Debate

byline.original: By Reid J. Epstein, Katie Glueck and Shane Goldmacher

docs.abstract: Heaven Frilot is normally a private person. But this is not a normal time. So she and her husband are now the face of the coronavirus for their conservative Louisiana community.
docs.snippet: Heaven Frilot is normally a private person. But this is not a normal time. So she and her husband are now the face of the coronavirus for their conservative Louisiana community.
docs.lead_paragraph: The only thing that should have been different about the first Friday in March was the apple crisp. Heaven Frilot didn’t usually cook at the end of the workweek, instead letting her family snack on leftovers — a roast or pork chops she’d made earlier, maybe — or order pizza. But her 10-year-old son, Ethan, was having a friend over that night, and her husband, Mark, a lawyer, was coming off a crushing week of arbitration. She would bake an apple crisp.

headline.main: Her Facebook Friends Asked if Anyone Was Actually Sick. She Had an Answer.
headline.print_headline: Is Anyone Actually Sick? Yes, She Told Her Friends, My Husband

docs.abstract: The billionaire was in the race for just over 100 days and won the support of 58 delegates.
docs.snippet: The billionaire was in the race for just over 100 days and won the support of 58 delegates.

headline.main: Michael Bloomberg Spent More Than $900 Million on His Failed Presidential Run
headline.print_headline: 100 Days, $900 Million, All to Earn 58 Delegates

docs.abstract: As President Trump appears at daily briefings, the Democratic front-runner faces the challenge of raising his profile in a presidential race that has moved almost entirely into the digital realm.
docs.snippet: As President Trump appears at daily briefings, the Democratic front-runner faces the challenge of raising his profile in a presidential race that has moved almost entirely into the digital realm.
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., the likely Democratic nominee against President Trump in this year’s general election, was asked a question during a virtual fund-raiser on Sunday that reflected a challenge looming over his campaign as the coronavirus outbreak intensifies.

headline.main: Biden Addresses a Visibility Question: ‘How Do We Get More of You?’
headline.print_headline: Biden Reacts To Challenge Of Visibility During Crisis

docs.abstract: As the coronavirus rages, Americans’ views of President Trump have risen slightly to reach record highs, polls show. But he remains polarizing.
docs.snippet: As the coronavirus rages, Americans’ views of President Trump have risen slightly to reach record highs, polls show. But he remains polarizing.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the United States now leading the world in confirmed coronavirus cases, Americans finally agree across party lines that the threat can’t be ignored.

headline.main: Can Trump Break a 50 Percent Approval Rating?
headline.print_headline: Voters Believe in Fighting Viral Threat, but Are Split Over Trump’s Response

docs.abstract: Unite the Country, a super PAC supporting Mr. Biden’s campaign, and the progressive group American Bridge are hoping to raise about $175 million together to defeat President Trump.
docs.snippet: Unite the Country, a super PAC supporting Mr. Biden’s campaign, and the progressive group American Bridge are hoping to raise about $175 million together to defeat President Trump.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two of the most prominent outside Democratic groups are forming a partnership to pool resources and research to help elect former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. this fall, an attempt at consolidating fund-raising in an increasingly competitive marketplace for third-party organizations.

headline.main: 2 Top Democratic Groups Form Alliance to Support Joe Biden
headline.print_headline: 2 Democratic Groups Form Alliance to Aid Biden

byline.original: By Jonathan Martin and Shane Goldmacher
